reviews.review: It's a game about killing floors.
FUN FUN FUN!!

Killing Floor, to me, is one of the best co-op designed games I've played to date. The game brings out all the classic, well-known weapons of shooters into the mix. Killing Floor revolves and works around how many players are in the game (1-6) and each wave of enemies increases in numbers the further you get. The more people that are in the server, the harder the final Patriarch boss is to kill.

The game has many classes and plenty of characters to choose from and you can level them up from 0-6 as you play them more frequently. If you're looking for a game that has all sorts of classes that master in almost any type of weapon out there, Killing Floor is the game for you. Perfect for when your only objective is to just kill things with your friends!
Da Gewaltgeminderte Version ,letzte Dreck ,ergo woanders kaufen !!!!  Wie ich es hasse das irgendwelche Schwuchteln mir in meinen Alter vorschreiben wollen was ich wie zu gamen habe .....
Best $20 Dollars I remember spending in a real long time. If you like killing zombies, get this game/

buy it.
Best zombie game ever. Better than Nazi Zombies.

Tripwire, une équipe de développement irréprochable, décide de se lâcher, après Red Orchestra, en sortant un jeu complètement loufoque. Son nom, Killing Floor. Le but est très simple à comprendre, survivre ! Six joueurs devront coopérer pour rester en vie et avoir la chance d'affronter le puissant Patriarch. Il existe suffisamment de cartes pour passer un long et agréable moment, seul ou entre amis. Le feeling des armes est, comment dire ? "Exceptionnel" ! Que ça soit avec un fusil, une mitraillette ou une arme de poing, les sensations sont bien là ! Pas un seul jeu ne l'égale dans ce domaine ! Les graphismes sont dépassés mais ne sont pas pour autant déplaisants. Bon... il y a tellement de chose à raconter que je risque d'y passer la soirée. Mes chers lecteurs, ils ne vous reste plus qu'une chose à accomplir , c'est de l'acheter !
Ah ! J'oubliais ! C'est un titre assez exigeant, il n'y a strictement rien pour vous assister.

This is the most compelling survival-horror game that I've ever played. Feel your power with powerful weapons and perks! It has different style and communication than Left 4 Dead 2. 
9/10
You're not here to escape from  zombies. You're here to slay them all. Class based, co-op surival game.  May not have the prettiest graphics, but it sure plays better than prettier games.

Killing Floor is an excellent game to play with friends and even by yourself.  It's an older engine, so it's guarenteed to run on older systems (but still has graphical flash for higher-end machines), overall it's a great multiplayer experience in conjunction with over 100+ achievements!
De la coop et des zombies! What else?
I want drugs, NOW!!!
It's like what you'd get if you took Nazi Zombies and gave it more than a shred of design sense.

A fun, challenging, and teamwork heavy game that gives that entertaining zombie-killing feel while keeping a dark and pressuring atmosphere due to the constant possiblities of death all around you. Your character will chant out somewhat humorous one-liners, while you yourself may be cursing everything since that one guy pissed off a fleshpound. Every class has its part in a team, abd if you don't do your own part well, it can spell a gruesome demise for the whole team. A truly engrossing indie experience.

Originally a mod for Unreal Tournament 2004, Killing Floor is a co-op  survival horror shooter with a playstyle akin to Left 4 Dead's survival mode. Shoot, incinerate, slice, and explode increasingly larger and tougher waves of hellish zombie mutants, while earning credits to go toward purchasing weapons, ammo, and armor from a trader between waves. Players can also earn perks to go toward specific class skills, like healing for medics or increased accuracy for shaprshooters. The game requirements are pretty low, so it should be able to run smoothly on all kinds of machines. Tons of fun with friends and with a great gloomy atmosphere, this is a game not to be missed. It's like Left 4 Dead and Resident Evil had a mutant baby on the...Killing Floor!

Don't play it on your own. Not because it's scary but because it's a bit crap without friends. It's an indie game that could be more polished but the core gameplay is fun. With a mate of two it can get very intense very quickly. It's not a forgiving game and any mistake you make will be quickly punished but if you are up for a tough, wave based survival horror, you could do much worse. Plan ahead with your team and you'll kick a lot of ass. The slow motion is really quite cool.

當初發售時被稱為英國版的L4D，但與L4D有很大的不同。Killing Floor是開放式地圖的生存模式，武器的選擇較多，甚至還有兵種與等級的設定，玩法變化性上比起L4D來得好。是很適合與好友同樂的Co-op型FPS。

Co-op + Mutants +Guns that have weight = 1 Helluvan apocolypse!!! Just staying alive is hard enough!!! But add boss mutants and you just added major realism to this game! Buy if you like difficult, coop, and apocolyptic games! (FPS Vets Reccommended!!!)

ok so lets say left 4 dead had a baby with call of duty zombies and that baby murdered them and became the supreme wave based survival game of all time that is finally getting a sequal, a full bugeted sequal because it sold so many copies, so if you arnt one of the 1.5 or something million people who were cool and bought this game than go ahead and click that little button, and i know i said KF2 is coming and some of you may be like oh but the second ones coming ill just wait and buy that, well for one if your faint at heart i dont recomend buying either. but if you can handle some chunky meat bits and brains that this is for sure your game, whilst the second one is going for the most realistic brutality in a game ever...and they are succeding...and it is beautiful. but still theres a large community and no release date for KF2 yet so buy this come on its $20 at max and often goes on sale on holidays so if your like damn i could buy this or that with $20 man, then get $5 befor summer, halloween. or the "hollidays" and youll not only get this awesome game but the special charecters and maps usually put out on those seasons, nothing better than a demented mutant gingerbread man trying to rip your intestines out with a candycane arm, or those circus freaks, or those psychopathic canible mutant extended redneck familys. and also GUUUUUUUUUUUNNNNNNNZZZZZ! lots of guns and things to brutalize the ZED's (genetically created Zombies originally for the military) so yeah, pistols,rifles,crossbow,sniper,shotguns,Machineguns,RPG,nadelauncers,and a chainsaw if you feel up close and personal or any other various weapons...theres a lot of them. but yeah 6 player co-op default, modded servers go higher theres solo for when your offline or you dont want to deal with people. its captivating, it flows, and it runs well on a multitude of computers.

One of the most balanced and intense multiplayer hidden gems I've played in a while.  It has the dirty, disgusting, and gory content that Left 4 Dead lacks.  It's class system, along with people knowing their role, are the keys to success at later difficulties.  The ability to weld doors and use the environment rather than following the rails (L4D) also make this a great game. The difficulty curve in regards to the difficulty setting and number of players is spot on.  Although it's running on an older engine, the eye candy is still there on the highest settings.  This is one of those games I regret not getting sooner because I've gotten more than my money's worth than I have from some other games.
It might be a simplistic UT mod but goddamn this game is TONS of fun. Its like Firefight done right in a sense of class choosing and the weapon variety. A+ game if you ask me

Its has Killing. And it has lotsa floors. Great team game fun! Really enjoy taking your frustrations out on the zombie hoards. Some great monsters to gib. Possibly the best shooter on Steam. 100% recommend.

This FPS Co-Op Servival Horror game based on the UT2 Engine is very fun, not a game i can play all day every day, but on most days :) 

With 7 classes to play and just over 40 wepaons to play with, some being optional DLC weapons, it makes for some gratifying zombie killing fun!!! The weapons range from duel pistols to  a LAW rocket launcher, Flame throwers to a .50 cal Sniper Rifle...and some insane ideas that just make it silly...but in a good way.
 
Levels are well made with the environment changing from a wecked ocean freighter to the streets of london to a secret forest research lab and a deralict asylum used for rave parties, there is something new to see in every map.

a MUST for any gamer who is thinking of getting this game! If you are reading this? stop right now and click the buy button, just go and do it.

If you like shooters / zombies i cannot rate this highly enough... it is easy on the controls and not to hard for new people who start to play it  and should run on a low end machine quite comfortably
 
it still has a good following of players in case your wondering about servers, you will always get on a server easily

One last thing it has a lot of cheap and good Dlc like new characters / weapons /accessories 
you should get this on a sale when its available but to be honest its worth the Retail  Price there asking for it ............Recommended Highly

There is a reason this indie game showed up Valve's L4D.  It is pure simple fun, a call back to the hey-dey of the Doom type shooter, where the goal was simply to kill monsters and not dispense terrible terrible story.  It does have minor RPGish elements in the form of selectable classes.  With the Unreal Engine 2, there are a multitude of quality maps available.

A quality game that suffers from the same problem most multiplayer games (particularly Left 4 Dead to which this game is frequently compared) do: Other people.

If you don't communicate well or if you intend to go one man army here you WILL go down unless you've mastered the game (a harrowing process made very difficult by the steep levelling curve) and your team will suffer for it since each team member or jackass with an internet connection adds to the total enemies present in each wave regardless of whether or not they're contributing.

But provided you communicate well or have a friend backing you up then you'll certainly enjoy Killing Floor for the frantic, power-metal blasting shoot-em-up that it is.  Admittedly some levels are better designed than others and certain classes can break the game given the proper conditions the game will always maintain a challengeing difficulty for players of any level provided you're not on easy mode.

Overall, worth the price.

Killing Floor Review

8.5/10 - Repetitive maiming of zombies becomes redundant after some time. But perks, customizable maps, spectacular community, and difficulties make up for that. Although, there is still a wide range of improvement including but not limited to: New weapons, new specimens, (possibly) new perks, and tweaks to original perks. Killing Floor in my honest, and utmost serious opinion, is a certainly a worthy buy for all its worth. If survival/horror is in your forte and/or repertoire, certainly you can spare $20.00 on Killing Floor. Just buy it before I slap your knickers.

-John Nguyen

Great! I have well over 30+ hours on this! ( and for an indie game for me it's alot) very fun, especially whith friends. It would be a 10/10 for me but the lack of guns and some more effort drop it down to a 9/10. Still very good score though.

Killing floor depicts a group of 1-6 players in their struggle to hold off the horrifically mutated experiments of a demented scientist. The game origins from a mod for Unreal Tornament 2003 (another game I highly recommend for its awesomness) and thus runs on the older Unreal Engine. This does not detract from the game itself as it still offers hours of fun and possible fear! Also, it is set in England. Which automatically means the characters have strong Cockney accents. Think of it as zombies with Ray Winstone and Michael Caine. 4.5 stars out of 5.

This is a great game to get some friends together and take down some genetically engineered horrors. Killing Floor being kind of a mixed bag with bits from different genres like Counter-Strike and Left 4 Dead and maybe an RPG, you and your friends strive to survive wave upon wave of "Zeds" of differing varieties. Fortifying areas by welding doors closed, collecting money along the way to buy new weapons, armor, ammo and killing baddies to raise your status on one of several "perks" you choose until the final battle with the Matriarch. There are even varying difficulties and map times to challenge your team in this ultimate battle to survive. Totally a game worth having in your collection.

The best zombie killing game ever. It's a first person co-op wave-based survival shooter with a persistent perks system. Basically, you kill zombies, and by killing zombies you level up that method of zombie killing to assist your zombie killing abilities. Weapons and cash do not carry over from one game to another, but levels do. After the final wave, the Patriarch appears, which is a zombie that hits hard, does lots of damage quickly with a minigun, has a rocket launcher, and can even turn invisible when he needs to heal. After either your squad or the patriarch dies, you play a new map and start over again.

The best part is that the game is updated frequently, so there's always something new to attempt.
do it
